meanings.definition: A type of white blood cell that engulfs and digests cellular debris, foreign substances, microbes, cancer cells, and anything else that does not have the types of proteins specific to healthy body cells.
meanings.sent1: The macrophages in our body help fight off harmful germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how macrophages work to keep us healthy.
meanings.sent3: The macrophages were like tiny superheroes fighting invisible villains.
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield of the body, macrophages are the fearless warriors.
meanings.sent5: Imagine macrophages as tiny Pac-Man cells gobbling up invaders.

meanings.definition: A large phagocytic cell found in stationary form in the tissues or as a mobile white blood cell, especially at sites of infection.
meanings.sent1: At the site of infection, macrophages work hard to protect us.
meanings.sent2: The macrophages move around the body to find harmful invaders.
meanings.sent3: The macrophages at the party were always on the move, like busy detectives.
meanings.sent4: In the war against illness, macrophages are the vigilant guards.
meanings.sent5: The image of macrophages patrolling the body is both fascinating and reassuring.
